trans-unit.source: Provides the Authenticode X.509v3 digital signature of a code assembly as evidence for policy evaluation.
This class cannot be inherited.
The presence of Publisher evidence produces a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission> in the grant set.

If there is a <xref:System.Security.CodeAccessPermission.Demand%2A> for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission>, the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission> that corresponds to the Publisher evidence will be compared with the demanded permission.
Publisher evidence is based on Authenticode X.509v3 signatures.
By default, code access security (CAS) does not check for Publisher evidence.

Unless your computer has a custom code group based on the <xref:System.Security.Policy.PublisherMembershipCondition> class, you can improve performance by bypassing Authenticode signature verification.
This is accomplished by configuring the runtime to not provide Publisher evidence for CAS.
For more information about how to configure this option and which applications can use it, see the element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref> class with the Authenticode X.509v3 certificate containing the publisher's public key.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref> that contains the software publisher's public key.
The cert parameter is .
Gets the publisher's Authenticode X.509v3 certificate.
The publisher's <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref>.
Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
A new object that is a copy of this instance.
Creates an equivalent copy of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref>.
A new, identical copy of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref>.
Creates an identity permission that corresponds to the current instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Evidence"></xref> from which to construct the identity permission.
A <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.PublisherIdentityPermission"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref>.
Compares the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref> to the specified object for equivalence.
<xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher> objects are equal if they designate the same software publisher certificate.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref> to test for equivalence with the current object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the two instances of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref> class are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The o parameter is not a object.
Gets the hash code of the current <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher.Certificate*>.
The hash code of the current <xref:System.Security.Policy.Publisher.Certificate*>.
Returns a string representation of the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref>.
A representation of the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Publisher"></xref>.
